channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9369] Add support for 1- and 2-byte integers in OrderedBytes and provide types
item.summary: Add support for 1- and 2-byte integers in OrderedBytes and provide types

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This is patch against the trunk which depends on HBASE-8201, so it can also work on 0.95.2 and 0.96
Added support for int8/byte and int16/short OrderedBytes encodings.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12602533/HBASE-9369.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 1 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

-1 site. The patch appears to cause mvn site goal to fail.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7145//testReport/

This message is automatically generated.
Can we get JIRA admin who can assign this ticket to its fearless contributor? (cc stack).
done
Nick Dimiduk I added you (and rajeshbabu) as administrators of hbase project in JIRA so you should be able to do the addition of new contributors yourself (and subsequent assigns)
Nick Dimiduk This going to make it in?

Looking at this now (sorry for the delay He Liangliang).

stack The one thing that makes me want to squeeze this in is to reserve bytes for the additional datatypes in a logical order. I can prepare a 4-line patch for the RC to make breathing room for the rest. Let me know.
Nick Dimiduk go for it

Opened and posted a patch on HBASE-9567. It makes room for the two new types here and gives us a little more breathing room for new encodings in the future.

Would be nice to get that one in before the RC but isn't mandatory.

Except for some whitespace issues, I'm +1 here. Running tests locally after rebasing onto the changes I introduced with HBASE-9567.

Will commit both of these for 0.96 shortly unless I hear otherwise.
patch rebased onto HBASE-9567 and cleanup whitespace.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12603741/0001-HBASE-9369-Add-support-for-1-and-2-byte-integers-in-.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 4 new or modified tests.

-1 hadoop1.0. The patch failed to compile against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

That failure is not yours Nick Dimiduk I'm on it over in HBASE-9569
Patch looks harmless. Just addition. +1
Committed to 0.96 and trunk. Thanks Liangliang!

This issue was closed as part of a bulk closing operation on 2015-11-20. All issues that have been resolved and where all fixVersions have been released have been closed (following discussions on the mailing list).

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: This change adds support for 8- and 16-bit integral types. It also alters the header byte written by OrderedBytes for NAN, FIXED_INT32, FIXED_INT64, TEXT, BLOB_VAR, and BLOB_COPY values. Data of those types written using a 0.95 release will be incompatible with this change.
